physical_appearance: This is a kebaya. The fabric is printed with pink peonies. The kebaya is scalloped around the edges. It has an elongated tapered ends and sleeves.
sgcool_label_text: This kebaya is printed with sprays of pink peonies and scalloped at its finely sewn edges. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
subject_terms_1: folk costume flowers (motifs) Peranakan tops (garments, general) blouses (main garments)
subject_terms_2: Ethnic costume Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Blouses
